<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Attempt to write a symbol table to the bitcode file. This must be called</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// at most once after all modules have been written.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A reader does not require a symbol table to interpret a bitcode file;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the symbol table is needed only to improve link-time performance. So</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// this function may decide not to write a symbol table. It may so decide</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if, for example, the target is unregistered or the IR is malformed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitcodewriter/#aaaca861df948bd93da0afb6891e9d662">writeSymtab</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Write the bitcode file&#39;s string table. This must be called exactly once</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// after all modules and the optional symbol table have been written.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Value in \\c M.  These will be reconstructed exactly when \\a M is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// deserialized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If \\c Index is supplied, the bitcode will contain the summary index</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (currently for use in ThinLTO optimization).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p GenerateHash enables hashing the Module and including the hash in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// bitcode (currently for use in ThinLTO incremental build).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If \\p ModHash is non-null, when GenerateHash is true, the resulting</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// hash is written into ModHash. When GenerateHash is false, that value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is used as the hash instead of computing from the generated bitcode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Can be used to produce the same module hash for a minimized bitcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// used just for the thin link as in the regular full bitcode that will</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldPreserveUseListOrder = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GenerateHash = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">                        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2b53e399f7a71b096a6caef6be6ff12d">ModuleHash</a> &#42;ModHash = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Write the specified thin link bitcode file (i.e., the minimized bitcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// file) to the given raw output stream, where it will be written in a new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bitcode block. The thin link bitcode file is used for thin link, and it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only contains the necessary information for thin link.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ModHash is for use in ThinLTO incremental build, generated while the IR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bitcode file writing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a33564097625c6a9b619c60a71343c058">writeThinLinkBitcodeToFile</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;Out,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulesummaryindex">ModuleSummaryIndex</a> &amp;Index,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Write the specified module summary index to the given raw output stream,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// where it will be written in a new bitcode block. This is used when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// writing the combined index file for ThinLTO. When writing a subset of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// index for a distributed backend, provide the \\p ModuleToSummariesForIndex</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// map. \\p DecSummaries specifies the set of summaries for which the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5858c9c8d861a0d36e7c8f99b8faf7fe">writeIndexToFile</a>(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If EmbedBitcode is set, save a copy of the llvm IR as data in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#95;&#95;LLVM,&#95;&#95;bitcode section (.llvmbc on non-MacOS).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If available, pass the serialized module via the Buf parameter. If not,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pass an empty (default-initialized) MemoryBufferRef, and the serialization</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// will be handled by this API. The same behavior happens if the provided Buf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is not bitcode (i.e. if it&#39;s invalid data or even textual LLVM assembly).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If EmbedCmdline is set, the command line is also exported in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the corresponding section (&#95;&#95;LLVM,&#95;cmdline / .llvmcmd) - even if CmdArgs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// were empty.</span></CodeLine>
